Entities.Name: Tumor Reference
Entities.Definition: Mentions of possible tumors in radiology reports.

Sample Data.Annotated Sentence: Lesions(1) consistent with HCC given their enhancement characteristics.

Entities.Name: Tumor Count
Entities.Definition: The number of possible tumors, including numerical values and qualitative terms like 'multiple'.

Sample Data.Annotated Sentence: Lesion(2) in segment 8 measuring 1.2 x 1.3 cm previously measuring 1.3 x 1.7 cm.

Entities.Name: Largest Tumor Size
Entities.Definition: The largest size of a malignant tumor found in the radiology report.

Sample Data.Annotated Sentence: The largest lesion in segment 5/6 measures 4.5 x 4.4 cm.

Entities.Name: Tumorhood Evidence
Entities.Definition: Descriptive terms providing evidence about the type or identity of a tumor.

Sample Data.Annotated Sentence: Hypervascular lesion(1) in hepatic segment II/III with imaging features suspicious for hepatocellular carcinoma.

Entities.Name: Measurement
Entities.Definition: Quantitative findings related to tumors, typically in centimeters.

Sample Data.Annotated Sentence: A hypervascular lesion measuring 2.5 x 3.0 cm.

Entities.Name: Anatomy
Entities.Definition: Anatomic locations where the tumors are found in the liver or adjacent structures.

Sample Data.Annotated Sentence: Lesion in segment 4A measuring 1.2 x 0.9 cm.

Entities.Name: Negation
Entities.Definition: Indicates the absence of a tumor or specific characteristic.

Entities.Name: >50% Liver Invasion
Entities.Definition: Determines if tumors invade more than 50% of the liver.

Sample Data.Annotated Sentence: Multifocal HCC with malignant vascular invasion of the right portal vein and IVC.

Dataset.Name: Liver Tumor Reference Resolution and Characteristic Extraction Corpus
Dataset.Details: A dataset of 101 annotated abdomen radiology reports from 160 hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC) patients, labeled with tumor references, measurements, anatomic locations, and malignancy attributes.
Dataset.Link: Not explicitly mentioned in the document.

Annotation Guidelines.Description: Guidelines for annotating tumor references, characteristics, and coreference resolution in liver cancer radiology reports.
